message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the World Development Indicator dataset, we analyze the relationship between population growth and economic development.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicator"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Our study draws on survey data collected from households in rural areas of India, as well as satellite imagery data to examine the impact of climate change on crop yields.", "dataset": ["survey data collected from households in rural areas of India", "satellite imagery data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use a combination of two datasets, one on public-private partnerships and another on regional integration, to investigate the relationship between infrastructure investment and economic development.", "dataset": ["public-private partnerships", "regional integration"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Regional Integration", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "The Global Findex dataset provides valuable information on financial inclusion, which we cross-reference with census data on income and education to study the drivers of global inequality.", "dataset": ["Global Findex dataset", "census data on income and education"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using data on mobile money usage from both providers and consumers in Kenya, we explore the impact of increased financial access on poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["data on mobile money usage"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize different sources of data, including national demographic and health surveys and healthcare utilization data, to examine the impact of maternal and child health interventions on nutrition outcomes in Sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["national demographic and health surveys", "healthcare utilization data"], "topic": ["Health", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses household budget survey data and trade data to investigate the effects of trade liberalization on income distribution in South Asia.", "dataset": ["household budget survey data", "trade data"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis combines survey data from smallholders in Indonesia, as well as climate data on temperature and precipitation to examine the impact of climate change on agricultural productivity.", "dataset": ["survey data from smallholders in Indonesia", "climate data on temperature and precipitation"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using data on firm-level productivity and export performance, we analyze the impact of extractive industries on economic development in Latin America.", "dataset": ["data on firm-level productivity and export performance"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This paper utilizes both qualitative and quantitative data from multiple sources, including government records and fintech firms, to explore the potential benefits and risks of digital financial services for low-income households in Africa.", "dataset": ["government records", "fintech firms"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Digital Development"]}]
